topHeadline: Trump Administration to Stop Measuring Food Insecurity
snippet: The move strips the government of its main gauge of hunger in America, and will impede efforts to track the impact of aid cuts.
lead: The move strips the government of its main gauge of hunger in America, and will impede efforts to track the impact of aid cuts.

events.title: Pentagon places further restrictions on journalists' access

events.title: Trump publicly pushes Attorney General Pam Bondi to prosecute his political foes
events.summary: President Donald Trump exerted public pressure Saturday night on Attorney General Pam Bondi, saying it was time for the Justice Department to take action against a number of his political foes

topHeadline: Trump looms over New Jersey's race for governor as candidates clash in their first debate
snippet: Voters in New Jersey may not be see the president on the ballot when they select their next governor in November, but President Donald Trump still looms over t…
lead: Voters in New Jersey may not be see the president on the ballot when they select their next governor in November, but President Donald Trump still looms over the race, with the candidates clashing over his administration’s policies in their first debate.

events.title: 12 Emotional Hours: A Spectator Reflects on One Full Day (Without Caffeine)
events.summary: Attending Charlie Kirk’s memorial involved lots of standing, worrying and waiting. But for one Colorado Springs woman, it was all worth it.

events.title: The H-1B Visa: Why Is Trump Adding a $100,000 Fee?
events.summary: President Trump signed a proclamation on Friday adding a $100,000 fee to visas for skilled foreign workers. Immigration hard-liners have criticized the program for replacing American workers.

lead: Pennsylvania authorities have charged a man with allegedly bringing two teenaged girls into the U.S. from Mexico and Guatemala and then forcing them to work on a farm for little or no pay, the state attorney general said Monday

events.title: For Trump, Who Has ‘Strong Feelings’ About Autism, the Issue Is Personal
events.summary: The president delivered impassioned — if scientifically dubious — remarks about what he described as one of “the most alarming public health developments in history.”

events.title: Mamdani Lands Endorsement From Kamala Harris, His Biggest Yet
events.summary: “I support the Democrat in the race,” Ms. Harris said during an interview with Rachel Maddow. She added of the Democratic Party, “we’ve got a big tent and we’ve got a lot of stars.”

topHeadline: Trump Cancels Meeting with Democrats, Bringing Shutdown Closer
snippet: President Trump canceled a planned meeting with congressional Democrats ahead of the looming government funding deadline, escalating the risk of a shutdown. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}
lead: President Trump canceled a planned meeting with congressional Democrats ahead of the looming government funding deadline, escalating the risk of a shutdown. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

events.title: Trump Cancels Meeting with Democrats, Bringing Shutdown Closer
events.summary: Trump cited “unserious and ridiculous” demands by Democrats, calling off a crucial meeting meant to negotiate spending before the fiscal year ends September 30. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

events.title: Trump Scraps Meeting with Democrats, Raising Government Shutdown Risk
events.summary: By canceling talks with top Democrats, Trump intensifies the standoff over funding and raises stakes for a partial government shutdown. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

events.title: At UN, President Trump Champions Sovereignty, Rejects Globalism
events.summary: In his address to the 80th session of the UN General Assembly, Trump pushed back against globalism and framed a vision of sovereign nations resisting interference. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

events.title: Trump Claims Acetaminophen Use Linked to Autism, Draws Backlash
events.summary: Trump advised pregnant women to limit use of acetaminophen, claiming it raises autism risk—remarks swiftly denounced by medical experts as unscientific. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

topHeadline: Trump Administration Eyes More Mass Layoffs if Government Shuts Down
snippet: The president’s top aides told agencies to prepare for potential firings if Congress cannot extend funding before the end of Sept. 30.
lead: The president’s top aides told agencies to prepare for potential firings if Congress cannot extend funding before the end of Sept. 30.

events.title: Trump Administration Eyes More Mass Layoffs if Government Shuts Down
events.summary: The president’s top aides told agencies to prepare for potential firings if Congress cannot extend funding before the end of Sept. 30.

events.title: White House lays groundwork for mass government firings if there's a shutdown
events.summary: The Office of Management and Budget says in a memo that agencies should prepare reduction-in-force plans to accompany furloughs if a spending bill isn't passed next week.

events.title: A Federal Shutdown May Be Imminent. How Would It Affect the Economy?
events.summary: Congress and the White House have days to fund the government and avert a disruptive and potentially costly lapse in funding.
